description: The Abalone dataset is used to predict the age of abalone based on physical measurements. Since determining age traditionally requires cutting the shell and counting rings under a microscope, this dataset provides an alternative approach using easily obtainable features. It consists of both categorical and continuous attributes, including sex (M, F, I for infant), length, diameter, height, whole weight, shucked weight, viscera weight, and shell weight. The target variable, 'Rings,' represents the number of growth rings, and adding 1.5 approximates the abaloneâ€™s age in years. This dataset is widely used for regression tasks in machine learning.
task: Predict the age of abalone based on physical measurements.

features.Length: Longest shell measurement in millimeters (continuous, ratio)
features.Diameter: Diameter perpendicular to the length in millimeters (continuous, ratio)
features.Height: Height with meat in shell in millimeters (continuous, ratio)
features.Whole_weight: Whole weight of the abalone in grams (continuous, ratio)
features.Shucked_weight: Weight of the meat in grams (continuous, ratio)
features.Viscera_weight: Weight of the gut in grams (continuous, ratio)
features.Shell_weight: Weight of the shell after drying in grams (continuous, ratio)
features.Rings: Number of growth rings, adding 1.5 gives the age in years (continuous, ratio)

Data Consistency: Lower cased 3% of the values in the Sex column
Added a slightly noisy version of Shell_weight named Shell_thickness. They have 95% correlation
Null Value Management: Added 5% null values to the Length column
Added 5% null values to the Height column
Added 5% null values to the Viscera_weight column
Outlier Management: Added 5% outliers to the Height by multiplying by 3
Made 5% of the Shucked_weight values negative to simulate left side outliers
Feature Engineering: Whole_weight column needs to be dropped due to high correlation with other features
Either diameter or length column should be dropped due to high correlation with each other
